com.i2group.apollo.adminservice
Interface IAdminService

public interface IAdminService

A set of methods for performing administrative functions on a running instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.

Since:
2.0

Method Detail

getSchema

SchemaResult getSchema()
Gets a SchemaResult that contains the Schema for this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform. If no Schema has been set, the SchemaResult is empty.

Returns:
See above.
Since:
5.0

setSchema

void setSchema(Schema schema)
               throws InvalidArgumentException,
                      SchemaValidationException,
                      ValidationException
Sets the Schema for this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.

If the Analysis Repository does not yet exist, this method creates it from the specified Schema, with a default name. To set a custom name, call setRepositoryName(java.lang.String).

If the Analysis Repository already exists, this method updates it to use the specified Schema, according to the following rules:

  • The identifier of the specified Schema must match the identifier of the current Schema.
  • The version of the specified Schema must be greater than the version of the current Schema.
Breaching any of the following rules causes a SchemaValidationException to be thrown:
  • The updated Schema may not remove existing ItemTypes.
  • The updated Schema may not remove PropertyTypes from an existing ItemType.
  • The updated Schema may not remove PropertyGroupTypes from an existing ItemType.
  • The updated Schema may not remove an entry from a "suggested" or "selected-from" list for an existing ItemType.
  • The updated Schema may not remove an identifier from the list of permitted "to" or "from" EntityType identifiers for an existing LinkType.
  • The updated Schema may not alter an existing PropertyType so that its LogicalType is different, except in the following limited circumstances:
    • It is permitted to change from a single-line string to a multiple-line string or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a selected-from string to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a suggested-from string to a single-line string or a multiple-line string.
    • It is permitted to change from a Boolean to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from an integer to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, a suggested-from string, a double, or a decimal.
    • It is permitted to change from a date to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a time to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a decimal to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a double to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
  • The updated Schema may not alter an existing PropertyType so that it is made mandatory.
  • The updated Schema may not remove an existing default value.

Parameters:
schema - The Schema to be used by this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - If the argument is null.
SchemaValidationException - If the Schema is not valid.
ValidationException - If the Schema is being updated and the identifier does not match the current Schema, or the version is not greater than the current Schema.
Since:
5.0

getRepositoryName

RepositoryNameResult getRepositoryName()
Gets a RepositoryNameResult that contains the human-readable name of the Analysis Repository for this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform. If the Analysis Repository does not yet exist, the RepositoryNameResult is empty.

getSecuritySchema

Gets a SecuritySchemaResult that contains the SecuritySchema for this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform. If no SecuritySchema has been set, the SecuritySchemaResult is empty.

Returns:
See above.
Since:
5.0

setSecuritySchema

void setSecuritySchema(SecuritySchema securitySchema)
                       throws InvalidArgumentException,
                              ValidationException
Sets the SecuritySchema for this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.

If the SecuritySchema has not previously been set, then this method initializes it. Breaching any of the following rules causes a ValidationException to be thrown:

  • The SecuritySchema must contain at least one "access" and one "grant" SecurityDimension.
  • Every SecurityDimension in the SecuritySchema must contain at least one value.
  • The identifiers of SecurityDimensions must be unique across the SecuritySchema.
  • The identifiers of SecurityTagGroups and SecurityTags must be unique across the SecuritySchema.
  • Every SecurityTagGroup in the SecuritySchema must contain at least one SecurityTag.
  • Every SecurityTag in the SecuritySchema must contain at least one SecurityAccessPermission or SecurityGrantPermission.
  • Every security permission in a SecurityTag in the SecuritySchema must reference a valid dimension-value pair.
  • A SecurityTag in the SecuritySchema must not contain the same security permission twice.

Note: SecuritySchemas are not validated at creation. Rather, the Intelligence Analysis Platform validates them during initialization, according to the rules above.

If the SecuritySchema has previously been set, then this method updates it. Breaching any of the initialization rules, or any of the additional rules below, causes a ValidationException to be thrown:

  • The new SecuritySchema cannot add or remove SecurityDimensions.
  • The new SecuritySchema cannot remove existing SecurityDimension values.
  • The new SecuritySchema cannot add or remove SecurityTagGroups.
  • The new SecuritySchema cannot remove existing SecurityTags.
  • The new SecuritySchema cannot add, remove, or change the security permissions within a SecurityTag.

Parameters:
securitySchema - The SecuritySchema to be used by this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - If the argument is null.
ValidationException - If the SecuritySchema is not valid.
Since:
5.0

getChartingSchemes

ChartingSchemeList getChartingSchemes()
Gets a ChartingSchemeList that contains the ChartingSchemes for this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform. If no ChartingSchemes have been set, the ChartingSchemeList is empty.

ValidationException - If the ChartingSchemes in the argument are invalid.

createDataSource

@Deprecated
void createDataSource(Schema schema,
                                 String name)
                      throws InvalidArgumentException,
                             SchemaValidationException,
                             ValidationException
Deprecated. Use setSchema(Schema) and setRepositoryName(String) instead.

Creates a DataSource with the specified name and the specified Schema.

This is a one-time operation; it is illegal to call this method twice, or to call it after setSchema(Schema) or setRepositoryName(String).

Parameters:
schema - The Schema to be used by the DataSource.
name - A String that contains the human-readable name of the new DataSource.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - If either of the arguments is null.
SchemaValidationException - If the Schema is not valid.
ValidationException - If a DataSource has already been created for this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.

updateDataSourceSchema

@Deprecated
void updateDataSourceSchema(Schema schema)
                            throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                   SchemaValidationException,
                                   ValidationException
Deprecated. Use setSchema(Schema) instead.

Updates the DataSource to use the specified Schema.

The identifier of the specified Schema must match the identifier of the current Schema, and its version must be greater than the version of the current Schema.

Breaching any of the following rules causes a SchemaValidationException to be thrown:

  • The new Schema may not remove existing ItemTypes.
  • The new Schema may not remove PropertyTypes from an existing ItemType.
  • The new Schema may not remove PropertyGroupTypes from an existing ItemType.
  • The new Schema may not remove an entry from a "suggested" or "selected-from" list for an existing ItemType.
  • The new Schema may not remove an identifier from the list of permitted "to" or "from" EntityType identfiers for an existing LinkType.
  • The new Schema may not alter an existing PropertyType so that its LogicalType is different, except in the following limited circumstances:
    • It is permitted to change from a single-line string to a multiple-line string or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a selected-from string to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a suggested-from string to a single-line string or a multiple-line string.
    • It is permitted to change from a Boolean to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from an integer to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, a suggested-from string, a double, or a decimal.
    • It is permitted to change from a date to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a time to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a decimal to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
    • It is permitted to change from a double to a single-line string, a multiple-line string, or a suggested-from string.
  • The new Schema may not alter an existing PropertyType so that it is made mandatory.
  • The new Schema may not remove an existing default value.

Parameters:
schema - The new Schema to be used by the DataSource.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - If the argument is null.
SchemaValidationException - If the Schema is not valid.
ValidationException - If the identifier of the new Schema does not match the current Schema, or the version is not greater than the current Schema.

initializeSecuritySchema

@Deprecated
void initializeSecuritySchema(SecuritySchema securitySchema)
                              throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                     ValidationException
Deprecated. Use setSecuritySchema(SecuritySchema) instead.

Initializes this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform with the specified SecuritySchema.

This is a one-time operation; it is illegal to call this method twice.

Breaching any of the following rules causes a ValidationException to be thrown:

  • The SecuritySchema must contain at least one "access" and one "grant" SecurityDimension.
  • Every SecurityDimension in the SecuritySchema must contain at least one value.
  • The identifiers of SecurityDimensions must be unique across the SecuritySchema.
  • The identifiers of SecurityTagGroups and SecurityTags must be unique across the SecuritySchema.
  • Every SecurityTagGroup in the SecuritySchema must contain at least one SecurityTag.
  • Every SecurityTag in the SecuritySchema must contain at least one SecurityAccessPermission or SecurityGrantPermission.
  • Every security permission in a SecurityTag in the SecuritySchema must reference a valid dimension-value pair.
  • A SecurityTag in the SecuritySchema must not contain the same security permission twice.

Note: SecuritySchemas are not validated at creation. Rather, the Intelligence Analysis Platform validates them during initialization, according to the rules above.

Parameters:
securitySchema - The SecuritySchema to be used by this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - If the argument is null.
ValidationException - If the SecuritySchema is not valid, or if this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform has already been initialized with a SecuritySchema.
Since:
4.0

updateSecuritySchema

@Deprecated
void updateSecuritySchema(SecuritySchema securitySchema)
                          throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                 ValidationException
Deprecated. Use setSecuritySchema(SecuritySchema) instead.

Updates this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform with the specified SecuritySchema.

Breaching any of the initialization rules, or one of the additional rules below, causes a ValidationException to be thrown:

  • The new SecuritySchema cannot add or remove SecurityDimensions.
  • The new SecuritySchema cannot remove existing SecurityDimension values.
  • The new SecuritySchema cannot add or remove SecurityTagGroups.
  • The new SecuritySchema cannot remove existing SecurityTags.
  • The new SecuritySchema cannot add, remove, or change the security permissions within a SecurityTag.

Parameters:
securitySchema - The new SecuritySchema to be used by this instance of the Intelligence Analysis Platform.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - If the argument is null.
ValidationException - If the SecuritySchema is not valid.
Since:
4.0
